title.narrative: VIOLENCE AGAINST CHILDREN

description.narrative: Caregivers and children have the knowledge and means to seek support relating to VAC and professionals have the capacity to provide inclusive, cross-sectoral support and rehabilitation, which contributes to Prevention Of Harmful Practice, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: More children, including those affected by humanitarian and emergency situations, will live in safe, non-violent and caring family environments and benefit from increased access to adequate, family-oriented services, quality alternative care, child-sensitive justice and protection from violence

sector.narrative: Ending violence against women and girls
Multi-sectoral coordination mechanisms to prevent and respond to violence, exploitation, abuse and neglect
Response and support services for girls, boys, and women experiencing violence, exploitaiton, abuse and neglect
Services to prevent or respond to gender-based violence in emergencies
Social and behaviour change and community engagement on VAC
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Technical assistance - Prevention and response services for violence against children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Caregivers and children have the knowledge and means to seek support relating to VAC and professionals have the capacity to provideinclusive, cross-sectoral support and rehabilitation

description.narrative: UNICEF successfully worked with key government and non-government partners to advance the VAC General Protocol, mainstream VAC indicators into the new e-data management system for social welfare, scaling up of child marriage prevention programmes and establishing ground for comprehensive response to ending violent disciplining of children. The promotion of specialized psychosocial and mental health assistance has been further supported including through innovative approaches to enable access of the most vulnerable children. Continued presence in the field ensures maintaining strategic monitoring and comprehensive assistance to refugee/migrant children, especially UASC, and those travelling irregularly and hardest to reach. | Status:Met | As-of Date:04/01/2022

Country has a functioning, national, multi-sectoral, multi-stakeholder coordination mechanism tasked with overseeing national plans or strategies to prevent and respond to violence against children and adolescents, with child and adolescent participation, Text

baseline.value: Coordination mechanism does not exist to oversee VAC strategy implementation

target.value: 2025:Coordination mechanism to oversee VAC Strategy implementation, is functional.
